title: PSA: Your Snowdown Shop's Offers
body:
There seem to be a lot of people with expectations of what the personalized sales offers are.  There've been a lot of people claiming that the champions you play the most have the highest chance of showing up in the store (reddit, in game, stream chat).  That's not necessarily the case, as the criteria for personalized offers are more extensive than that.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=aT1jnjFq,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-12-16T17:26:34.475+0000)
>
> the Snowdown shop will feature six unique champions or skins (excluding Legendary, Ultimate, and Limited) released more than three months ago) based on your playstyle. It's based on a ton of different factors, but playstyle is the best way to describe it. I think it'll make a bit more sense once you see the shop for yourself. 

As stated by Riot, the deals are based heavily on playstyle.  Likely factors include champion type, lane, and role.  They might also check data for previous skin theme purchases, or what types of champions you skin the most.  The goal for this promotion is obviously to get people to spend some RP (and thus money), but merely focusing on your main champions would be very shortsighted.  After all, pigeonholing you to your existing pool limits purchase options.  By offering you champions (and skins) similar to your existing playstyle, they are encouraging you to branch out to possibly unfamiliar champions that you statistically may enjoy.  Having more champions unlocked also creates more future sales potential for them since each champion has its own pool of alternate skins.

To those people claiming that being offered skins for champions they don't currently play is an example of coding error: It's not.  That isn't spaghetti code.  That's _marketing_.  There may have been coding errors responsible for the shop's delay, but that's a different issue.

And the skin is for a passive support who's main playstyle is sitting behind the carry and pressing W for heals every now and then.

Adding onto the above is that 2 of the skins in my shop are sidegrades: they aren't improvements on a skin I already own (like going from Outback to Scorched Earth/Pool party) but they aren't downgrades either (going from Scorched Earth/Pool Party to Outback). It's just some slightly discounted skins that don't offer anything extra to what I already have.

So overall I like the idea behind the shops, but at some point in their it messed up and offered discounts on things I would never be interested in getting anyway. Also, my friend got Dreadknight Garen in his shop which frankly seems like something that should never happen.

Just wanna start off by saying I'm not complaining about the sales I got, I wasn't really planning on buying any of them unless by slim chance I got Cosmic Reaver Kass on it. That being said, I'm a bit skeptical about the accuracy of these playstyle based picks.

Three of the six sales I got make little sense. 

To give you an idea of what I'm talking about, here are my top 6 played champions: {{champion:35}} {{champion:115}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:143}}.

The skins I got were for {{champion:35}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:59}} 

Of those three, Shaco and J4 make a ton of sense, and Voli has a similar enough playstyle to J4 to make sense, but Tahm, Yasuo, and Ashe just straight up don't. 

First off, Yasuo: I had a brief spell of playing yasuo top lane a few months ago, short of that I haven't touched the champion since his release. The champions I play don't reflect his playstyle at all, he's a fighter with high damage and mobility. I play little to no mobility mages, kiting supports, mobile assassins, and nearly full tank J4. I'm just not seeing Yasuo as a good match for this, but of these three this is the least confusing one.

On to Tahm Kench: Immobile tank support. The only tank I play is J4, who is highly mobile. You guys keep saying how easy it is to kite Tahm Kench and that's why his damage is so high, I'm sure the last thing used to describe J4 is 'easily kited'. Completely different playstyles.

And finally, the one that makes absolutely no sense at all, Ashe: I veeerry rarely play ADC, like at all. Sometimes when I'm forced to go bot lane as the 'marksmen' position, I'll play AP Ziggs instead because that's how much I hate ADC as a class. That being said, occasionally I'll break out Ezreal when I think Ziggs won't work in the comp. I've gotta say, Ezreal is probably the closest thing to opposite of Ashe as you can get. Ashe is immobile, has a ton of cc, and doesn't really have much poke or adequate burst from her spells. Ezreal is mobile, has no CC at all, and is completely poke and burst oriented. I just don't get it.

I like the idea of the store, it's pretty cool. My problem is that I got 2 Naut skins (Abyssal and Warden) both of which are downgrades to Astronautilus which I already own, 2 Gragas skins (Vandal and Scuba) of which I already own Superfan, Cryo brand which is a big downgrade from Zombie Brand which I also already own and Cutthroat Graves of which I already own Riot Graves...

So ultimately my disappointment is that all the skins I got were for champs I already had skins for and that for two champs I was given 2 skins each. I *wish* I got skins for champs I didn't play like others have, at least then there'd be something different for me. :S

If you do this shop again I feel that you shouldn't get multiple skins for the same champion and that the system should at least try to avoid champions that you already have skins for.

On the plus side it got my most recent roles pretty dead on (in fact I play heaps of Gragas and Naut and also used to do heaps of Brand when I could get mid) so that was nice.

I didn't buy a single one of my discounted skins. I had the money, but the system offered skins for champions that I either don't play, already have a better skin for, offered ugly skins, multiple skins for the same champion, or the magnitude of the discount did not warrant a purchase.

1. This one is easy to fix. Only offer skins for champions that have been played in the last two months or so. This point is far more important than the next three, since fixing those and not this would result in good skins with good offers that I would be pained to purchase since I would know it was a waste of money buying a skin for champions I don't like or play.

2. Also easy to fix, only offer skins that have a HIGHER base price than the skins I already own for that champion. For example, if I own Prestigious Leblanc (750), do not offer me Wicked Leblanc (520), but instead Ravenborn Leblanc (1350) -  a skin I would actually have any chance of purchasing.

3. This issue is difficult to satisfy, since every skin appeals to at least someone. I don't know how effective this would be, but look at colour schemes and common themes between the skins that the player has already purchased (not including gifts or mystery chests). This could help find out the players preferred skin style.

4. Riot should know that offering multiple skins for the same champion will result in less purchases than skins for two different champions. It's just a fact that there are people who see it as a waste to own more than one skin on a champion. Just don't do this.

5. Almost every skin in the game will eventually be on sale, usually at a larger discount than those offered in the snowdown shop. This means that buying the snowdown discounted skins results in spending more money than necessary. My solution would be to only offer discounts of 50% or HIGHER. Riot can almost  raise the discounts indefinitely and still profit.

Another potential improvement might be to give players 1 re-roll of their shop - but only the amount of deals that HAVEN'T been used. That way, you don't get players buying all of the first group then re-rolling for a new group. With a re-roll, it would allow players to get a chance at skins they might be interested in, while still only giving them a maximum of 6 deals.
